meta.title: Home - Elmbrook Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: The mission of the School District of Elmbrook is to educate and inspire every student, to think, to learn and to succeed.
The mission of the School District of Elmbrook is to educate and inspire every student, to think, to learn and to succeed.

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow fsItemCount_9 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailRectangle fsThumbnailLarge

div.a: District Celebrates 2020 Engaged in Excellence Award Finalists

p.img: Forty-six individuals and six teams have been selected asFinalists from over 700 nominations for the District's Engaged in Excellence Awards!

article.a: Read Full Story about District Celebrates 2020 Engaged in Excellence Award Finalists

div.a: Jennifer Roskopf, Jian Sun, and Scott Wheeler Elected to Elmbrook Board of Education

p.img: The Elmbrook Community is fortunate to have a highly professional and dedicated Board of Education. On April 7, 2020, Jennifer Roskopf, Jian Sun (Inc), and Scott Wheeler were elected to three-year terms on the seven-member Board. The next Elmbrook Board of Education meeting will occur May 19. Congratulations to Jennifer Roskopf, Jian Sun, and Scott Wheeler and thank you for your service!

article.a: Read Full Story about Jennifer Roskopf, Jian Sun, and Scott Wheeler Elected to Elmbrook Board of Education

div.a: Concurrency, ProHealth, Soerens Ford & SPX Transformer Solutions Named Outstanding Community Partners

div.p: Concurrency, ProHealth, Soerens Ford and SPX Transformer Solutions are the recipients of the District's 2020 Excellence in a Community Partnership award! These awards will be presented as part of the virtual Engaged in Excellence Awards celebration on Monday, May 11 that will be livestreamed at elmbrookschools.org/eie.

article.a: Read Full Story about Concurrency, ProHealth, Soerens Ford & SPX Transformer Solutions Named Outstanding Community Partners

div.a: Raising Readers in Elmbrook Web Series

p.img: Families of children ages 0-6 in the Elmbrook community are invited to view our new and ongoing web series, Raising Readers. This series offers a variety of activities, videos, and resources to help you engage your child in developing early literacy skills.New resources have been posted for April 2020!

article.a: Read Full Story about Raising Readers in Elmbrook Web Series

div.a: Marc Hughes & Chrissy Pappas Named Alumni Excellence Award Winners!

img.alt: L to R: Marc Hughes & Chrissy Pappas

p.img: Brookfield East graduate Marc Hughes ('79), and Brookfield Central graduate Chrissy Pappas ('13) are the recipients of the District's 2020 Alumni Excellence awards. These awards will be presented as part of the virtual Engaged in Excellence Awards celebration on Monday, May 11, which will be live-streamed at elmbrookschools.org/eie.

article.a: Read Full Story about Marc Hughes & Chrissy Pappas Named Alumni Excellence Award Winners!

div.p: Jeff "JT" Olson is a Spartan graduate who serves as the Founder and Executive Director of the Both Hands Foundation, helping to serve widows, orphans, and adoptive families.

article.a: Read Full Story about Alumni Spotlight: Jeff Olson

div.a: Elmbrook Students Honored By National Center for Women in Information Technology

div.p: The Wisconsin Affiliate of the National Center for Women in Information Technology (NCWIT) has announced the programs 2019-20 Wisconsin and National Honorees. NCWIT works to increase recruitment, retention, and advancement of girls in the field of information technology. Seven Elmbrook students were honored for their work in technology, including one that received a National Honorable Mention.

article.a: Read Full Story about Elmbrook Students Honored By National Center for Women in Information Technology

div.a: Elmbrook Mourns the Loss of Roger Bottoni

div.p: Roger Bottoni, former Tonawanda Principal, passed away on Wednesday, March 18. Roger began his 30-year career in Elmbrook as a teacher at Woodside School and transitioned to the role of Principal at Fairview North Elementary School. In 1970 he became the first Principal of Tonawanda Elementary School where he remained until his retirement in 1992.

article.a: Read Full Story about Elmbrook Mourns the Loss of Roger Bottoni

div.a: Public Service Announcement Elections and Census

div.p: In these unusual times, we have been asked to share several messages from our local and federal officials.

article.a: Read Full Story about Public Service Announcement Elections and Census

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

p.strong: Governor Declares Schools Closed for the Remainder of the Year

div.p: This afternoon, Governor Evers extended the Safer at Home order through Tuesday, May 26, and also declared that all public and private K-12 schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. The Districts Senior Leadership team is meeting on Friday (Apr 17) to discuss sustaining our approach to virtual learning and how the Governor's decision will impact events typically held at the end of a school year (e.g. graduation, promotion, recognition nights). We are committed to honoring our class of 2020 and finding ways to celebrate the accomplishments and extraordinary effort of all students and staff. Expect more information next week.

p.br:
Elmbrook Schools is offering all children ages 2-18 the option of a free bagged lunch meal for the duration of Virtual Learning, regardless of school attendance area, grade level, or income eligibility. This option is offered as part of the Federal Summer Meals Program, which has been extended to the school year to support all families in need. Please visit our Meals for Students webpage for additional information.
A list of resources for adults and children regarding Group & Community Assistance may be found here.

div.p: Virtual Learning will be in place for the duration of the public health emergency and no students will report to school.

ul.li: All District buildings will be closed to the public.
All before and after-school activities and community events held in our facilities are canceled.
All school playgrounds are closed indefinitely.
